statements: UPDATE SoloTravelDestinations SET user_reviews = 500 WHERE destination_id = 1;
UPDATE SoloTravelDestinations SET user_rating = 4.5, travel_preferences = 'Beach' WHERE destination_name = 'Hawaii';
UPDATE SoloTravelDestinations SET user_rating = 4.5, user_reviews = 200 WHERE destination_name = 'Tokyo';
UPDATE SoloTravelDestinations SET travel_preferences = 'Adventure, Nature' WHERE user_rating > 4.0;
UPDATE solo_travel_destinations SET avg_rating = 4.5, num_reviews = 100 WHERE destination_id = 1;
UPDATE user_preferences SET preference_1 = 'Beach', preference_3 = 'Mountains' WHERE user_id = 5;
UPDATE solo_travel_destinations SET avg_rating = 4.7, num_reviews = num_reviews + 10 WHERE destination_id = 1;
UPDATE user_preferences SET preference_1 = 'Beach', preference_2 = 'Adventure' WHERE user_id = 100;
UPDATE user_preferences SET destination = 'Beach', budget = 1000.00 WHERE user_id = 12345;
UPDATE destination_reviews SET rating = 4.5, review_text = 'Great experience!' WHERE review_id = 98765;
UPDATE user_preferences SET destination='London', budget=2000.50 WHERE user_id=101;
UPDATE destination_reviews SET rating=4.5, review_text='Great place to visit!' WHERE review_id=201;
UPDATE destinations SET rating = 4.5, user_reviews = 150 WHERE destination_id = 1;
UPDATE preferences SET user_id = 1001, destination_id = 2 WHERE preference_id = 3;
UPDATE destinations SET rating = 4.75, user_reviews = user_reviews + 1 WHERE destination_id = 1;
UPDATE reviews SET rating = 4.5, review_text = 'Great place to visit!' WHERE review_id = 1;
UPDATE destinations SET rating = 4.5 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE users SET age = 30, gender = 'Male', email = 'john.doe@example.com' WHERE id = 2;
UPDATE destinations SET name = 'Paris', rating = 4.5 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE users SET age = 32, gender = 'Male' WHERE id = 3;
